Detailed Description

Is used to split an input string based on a separator.

This function can either create a temporary buffer or destructively do it in-place. This class is provided for help constructing internal processing functions. It is not typically used. Consider CSplitBlob for retrieving elements of a string blob.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CSplitString::CSplitString ( const TCHAR *  szString,
TCHAR  tcSeparator,
TCHAR  tcEscape,
BOOL  bCopy,
BOOL  bSuppressLast 
) [inline]

Is used to split an input string based on a separator.

This function can either create a temporary buffer or destructively do it in-place.

Parameters:
szStringis the input string.
tcSeparatoris the separator character, generally either tab or newline.
tcEscapeis the escape character.
bCopyis whether to copy the data to a new buffer or destructively do it in-place.
bSuppressLastis whether to suppress the last empty field if it exists. (newline)(endofstring) is the typical case.

Member Function Documentation

TCHAR* CSplitString::GetItem ( int  nPos) [inline]

Returns the string item at nPos.

Parameters:
nPosis the position index.
Returns:
String item at the position index if exists. NULL if the position is out of range.
int CSplitString::GetNumberItems ( ) [inline]

Returns an integer number of items.

Returns:
The number of items. Note that an empty string is still one item. 0 is used if no string separation has occurred.
int CSplitString::GetNumberSeparators ( ) [inline]

Returns the number of separators found.

A singleton element has no separators.

Returns:
The number of separators found.
